items.preText:
Bangladesh have Mehidy partnering Liton Das.

3:28pm Aaaaand India's national anthem is done. More Bangladesh than India in the stands says my colleague Shashank Kishore from the ground. "The eastern terrace is still empty, and that's because direct sunlight is on that part of the ground from 330 to 5pm. It's impossible to sit there even if you have a cap and coolers. Those who are out there deserve some loyalty award."

3:25pm An early opening. Bangladesh's national anthem is being played first.

salim-bd: "@Vipra: As a BD fan, even I can not be that optimistic. Don't recall the last time BD genuinely challenged BD's top order, particularly in Rohit and Dhawan. And if, hypothetically, BD manage to get only 225, I doubt they'd have the mental presence to think they can win against an in-form top order of IND. I'm really pessimistic about this match-up because in the match with a full-strength BD side, incl. Shakib, IND won easily."

Raqibul: "I feel pity for poor Mominul. It's always him when it comes to the point of change someone for the team combination!"

Tushar Bhapkar: "Please recall 2011 WC final to negate all negative thoughts."

salman1508: "@Omair Ali, Sorry mate, we thought the same after Champions Trophy, and have realized how quickly things can turn around -- A Pakistani Fan."

Vipra: "Chasing under lights in Dubai seems very difficult.. The pitch slows down dramatically and grips a lot as game progresses. BD got it right with extra spinner in their playing eleven. If they get to 225+, they have the cup."

Avinash: "@Shailesh K : Forget CT finals. What pops up my mind is the 2003 WC final. Ah, that drubbing! "

Omair Ali: "As an Indian fan, it's great to see the bench strength of the Indian team compared to other Asian teams or any other team for that matter. We have got to give credit to the administration/infrastructure at root level and also selectors for picking the right players from a big lot. Of course, some players might not have got enough opportunity but hopefully the team management will improve on that part too. We have got a great bunch of bowlers and batters waiting in line. "

Mahneel Musa: "Bringing in a specialist bowler in place of a specialist batter seems like a very brave move given the constant woe in the Bangladeshi top order. Might as well turn out to be a decision they later regret." --- But the extra bowler will be handy when defending a total.



Dhaval: "During India's first match, you had put out this headline: Could Hong Kong upset a potentially second-string India? Barring a couple of players, it's pretty much the same team. And today I read this: Can spirited Bangladesh overcome full-strength India? #JustSaying" --- Remember how India made five changes last match? That was the potentially second-string team the preview writer might have expected India to field against Hong Kong. It's not that hard.

Shailesh K: "Are we repeating the same mistake like CT final last year?? Any final win toss and bat first put scoreboard pressure on opposition "

Avinash: "I want to see Rohit captain the test side just for his ability to win the tosses."

Bangladesh: Liton Das, Soumya Sarkar, Mohammad Mithun, Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), Imrul Kayes, Mahmudullah, Mehidy Hasan, Mashrafe Mortaza (capt.), Nazmul Islam, Rubel Hossain, Mustafizur Rahman

India: Rohit Sharma (capt.), Shikhar Dhawan, Ambati Rayudu, Dinesh Karthik, MS Dhoni (wk), Kedar Jadhav, Ravindra Jadeja, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal, Jasprit Bumrah

3:05pm We'll bring you the XIs shortly. Head over to the homepage and see what our experts have to say on Match Day. Mashrafe: Credit goes to the boys, the way they've behaved and stoof up the last few matches. We have to play hard today and fight till the last ball. Yes we felt were a spinner short, so we've changed that. Appu [Nazmul Islam] is coming in for Mominul. We have a great chance tonight, but you never know, they are the No. 1 side. There's always pressure in the final. If we can cope with it, we have a good chance. Rohit: Big game, runs on the board are important. But I guess fielding first is something that suits our team and we have done that superbly, no reason to change it. I think right from game on we knew it would be challenging and lot of people came here with great form, they came out and delivered that. We've played excellent cricket, just one hurdle to cross. We're ready for it. The sole purpose was to come and qualify for the final first and then come out and perform the way have performed. Don't need to change anything, even if it's a big occasion. We've got all five guys who missed out last time back. Unfortunate for the guys who played only one game, but whatever the team demands, we've got to respect that. India have won the toss and elected to bowl.

2:59pm Out come the captains for the toss.

Snehil: "I am really glad to see Marais Erasmus as one of the two umpires today, especially with the umpiring blunders in the last match. There has been a debate going around about having 2 reviews in ODIs. Your views?"

Yogesh: "The player with maximum pressure in this game has to be MSD. Probably hoping not be caught in a situation where he has to fire straight away"

And Sanjay Manjrekar thinks an India-Bangladesh final is reflective of the change in Asia's hierarchy.

While we wait for the toss, you should also dig into Shashank Kishore's primer on how the India-Bangladesh rivalry came to be.

Of course, if you're more visually inclined, we have it in video form: It might not be the final everyone wanted, but its a simmering rivalry in its own right.

2:35pm Good afternoon and welcome to our coverage of the final of the Asia Cup. India have taken the easy route - in fact, they've been in Dubai all along - to the final, beating everyone in their way and managing not to lose when their middle-order switched off against Afghanistan. Now their full strength XI is rested and ready to go against Bangladesh, who have had a more complicated time. Took some huffing and puffing and coming back strongly before they dismantled Pakistan a couple of days ago to make it today. Do they have one more surprise in them? We'll see. My name's Varun, I'll be joined by Sreshth Shah later. To set you up, here is Mohammed Isam's preview: Can spirited Bangladesh overcome full-strength India?
items.text: short of a length wide outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: length ball shaping away outside off, opens the face and jabs it wide of gully
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: short of a length and some curve into the corridor. Defends to point off the back foot
items.postText: Nayeem: "Surprise surprise, Mehidy Hasan in the opening for the first time. Mash told about opening surprise yesterday, now it goes...."
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, no run

items.text: just past gully who is diving full length to his right with one hand. Another poke away from the body from Liton against an outswinger. Zooms past Dinesh Karthik
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: length ball swinging away from the corridor, left alone
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: length ball swinging away from the corridor, defended to point off the front foot
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: short of a length and in at off stump. Allows it to come on and steers it past gully with soft hands
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: length ball just outside off, blocked solidly on the front foot
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: short and wide outside off, swipes at it and can't get bat away from the body
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: outside edge past first slip comfortably. Would probably not have carried to second either. Bumrah gets a length ball to straighten and Mehidy jabs at it unsurely but with soft hands
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs

items.text: length on off stump, defended with soft hands
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: short ball just outside off, opens the face but can't get this past gully
items.postText:
Shad: "Incidentally Mehidy's average is more than Litton Das's in ODIs. Ironies!"

Surajgreddy: "Mehidy living every gully(street) cricketers dream, opening the batting and bowling in an ODI! I remember Neil Johnson used to do that. Shane Watson also at times."
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: length on the pads, clipped to midwicket on the up
items.postText: An observation from Shashank at the ground: "Jasprit Bumrah actually starts running in after walking 12-13 steps from his mark. So the amount of pace he manages to generate from what's essentially a Ganguly-like run-up is amazing."
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length on the pads, allows it to come on and whips it to fine leg
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, 1 run

items.preText: Dev: "So what's his role here? Pinch hitter? Because he has a 18 average in ODIs. Surely they are not expecting him to play the anchoring role!" --- Just think it's a way of tightening up the lower-middle in the absence of one regular batsman (Mominul). He's not a pinch-hitter type of batsman.
items.text: length ball into the pads. He can't get the flick away and it deflects into the leg side off the pad
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 leg bye

items.text: short and very wide outside off. Goes after it with the cut but can't make connection
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, no run

items.text: nice looking shot. Allows it to swing into him, gets on top of the bounce of this short of a length ball and tucks it to fie leg's left
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, 2 runs

items.text: length in the corridor, follows it with his hands and stabs to backward point's left. It's Jadeja there, but they seem to have made the run as his throw comes in and misses
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: shot. It's Liton in all the glory he usually provides when he's making good connection. Length ball on middle stump, jumps down the track and uses his wrists to caress this through square leg
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: short and into the hips. A little hurried this time. He swivels and gets it through square leg
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, 2 runs

items.text: length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
items.postText: Sorry, for was missing The new season of the Indian Super League will bring a bittersweet moment for new Kerala Blasters defender Anas Edathodika - while a chance to finally play for a club from his home state is special, it will also bring back painful memories of the devastating floods in August that killed nearly 500 people. Here's his story.
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, 1 run

items.preText: Anjum: "@Surajgreddy, M.Hafeez used to do that as well and he was captain that time, a typical gully cricketer :D"
items.text: length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket off the back foot
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: length ball in the corridor, hurries onto him as he gets on the back foot to try and punch through cover. Can only slice to backward point
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: short ball slanted down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 wide

items.text: shot. Nicely on top of the bounce against this in the corridor, and gets a full punch through this time to get it through cover
items.postText: Shaunak: "Yes, its amazing how much pace Bumrah generates with virtually no run-up. But on the other side, it must be quite hard on his body. It will be interesting to see how much injury-free can he remain, especially after his inclusion in the Test squad!"
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs
